alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 3:19PM MDT until July 08 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cerro Pelado burn scar in... East Central Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... * Until 815 PM MDT. * At 319 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen in the Peralta, Colte, and Bland drainages. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Canada Camada, Peralta Canyon, Bland Canyon, Rio Chiquito, Tent Rocks National Monument, Cochiti Pueblo, and Cochiti Golf Club. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cochiti Pueblo and Pena Blanca. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of southeast parts of the Cerro Pelado fire burn area. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
